page.title: 05Cheadle Homes Survey
page.content: We surveyed 194 homes all of which were situated in Cheadle.Their ages varied from under 10 yrs(48),10-20yrs(52)20-50 yrs(53)& over 50yrs(27).Most of the householders worked in the Cheadle area but many were retired or unemployed. 109 homes had the use of a car but people would have made better use of Public Transport had it been cheaper and more available.Residents enjoyed living in Cheadle because of its proximity to lovely countryside & the friendliness of its people. Most people had spent their entire lives in Cheadle & had never had any desire to move.The 'newcomers' tended to be more critical of the lack of facilities for the young,the poor job prospects, the traffic congestion & the litter in the town centre.Most people thought that the High Street could be improved.
